at.mostlychaotic.jqcdm.structure

Interface ChecksumCalc

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    QcdmCrc

    public interface ChecksumCalc
    This interface defines methods for calculating arbitrary checksums. This interface is simple and its main purpose is to be able to hand an checksum-calculation method to a MessageBody or any other object that might want's to use it, without the hassle of deciding what to use and to initialize everything.
    Author:
    Kopfi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] calculate(byte[] data)
      This method calculates the checksum for the given data and returns it a byte array.
      java.lang.String getName()
      This method should return a name that identifies the checksum beneath different implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        This method should return a name that identifies the checksum beneath different implementations.
        Returns:
        a name

      • calculate

        byte[] calculate(byte[] data)
        This method calculates the checksum for the given data and returns it a byte array. The bytes of this array should already be sorted with least-significant byte first.
        Parameters:
        data - the data, to calculate the checksum on
        Returns:
        the checksum as byte array in LSB byte-order
